Package gov.nih.nlm.ling.sem

Class DomainProperties

  • java.lang.Object
    • gov.nih.nlm.ling.sem.DomainProperties

  • public class DomainProperties
extends java.lang.Object
    This class attempts to capture domain-specific semantic information as a static set of key/value pairs from a Properties object. Values are list of strings, separated by semicolon.

    Domain properties are expected to prefixed with domain. prefix. At the moment, keys can be two-level deep, each level separated by a period. An example of a single level domain property is domain.semtypes, an example of a two level domain property is domain.semtype.DISORDER. If more levels are needed, this class can be expanded.

    Author:
    Halil Kilicoglu

        public static java.util.List<java.lang.String> parse1​(java.lang.String key)

      • valueKey

        public static java.lang.String valueKey​(java.util.Map<java.lang.String,java.util.List<java.lang.String>> map,
